intro: Myosotis squarrosa, commonly known as the rough forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its blue or purple flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its ornamental value. Myosotis squarrosa is also valued for its role in ecological systems, supporting pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
